cursor.description: Used for pagination.  When a list request has more records available, cursors are provided in the response headers `X-Files-Cursor-Next` and `X-Files-Cursor-Prev`.  Send one of those cursor value here to resume an existing list from the next available record.  Note: many of our SDKs have iterator methods that will automatically handle cursor-based pagination.

per_page.description: Number of records to show per page.  (Max: 10,000, 1,000 or less is recommended).

sort_by.description: If set, sort records by the specified field in either `asc` or `desc` direction (e.g. `sort_by[created_at]=desc`). Valid fields are `created_at` and `as2_partner_id`.

filter.description: If set, return records where the specified field is equal to the supplied value. Valid fields are `created_at`.

filter_gt.description: If set, return records where the specified field is greater than the supplied value. Valid fields are `created_at`.

filter_gteq.description: If set, return records where the specified field is greater than or equal the supplied value. Valid fields are `created_at`.

filter_lt.description: If set, return records where the specified field is less than the supplied value. Valid fields are `created_at`.

filter_lteq.description: If set, return records where the specified field is less than or equal the supplied value. Valid fields are `created_at`.

as2_partner_id.description: As2 Partner ID.  If provided, will return message specific to that partner.

$ul: **activity_log**: JSON Structure of the activity log.
**as2_partner_id**: Id of the AS2 Partner associated with this message.
**as2_station_id**: Id of the AS2 Station associated with this message.
**attachment_filename**: Filename of the file being received.
**content_type**: Content Type header of the incoming message.
**encrypted_uri**: URL to download the encrypted signed smime that is to sent as AS2 body
**hex_recipient_serial**: Incoming Message Recipient(the Client Cert used to encrypt this message)'s serial in hex format.
**http_headers**: HTTP Headers sent with this message.
**http_response_code**: HTTP Response Code sent for this message
**http_response_headers**: HTTP Headers sent for this message.
**mdn_response_uri**: URL to download the http response body
**mic_algo**: AS2 Message Integrity Check Algorithm Used
**raw_uri**: URL to download the original file contents
**recipient_issuer**: Incoming Message Recipient(the Client Cert used to encrypt this message)'s issuer
**recipient_serial**: Incoming Message Recipient(the Client Cert used to encrypt this message)'s serial
**smime_signed_uri**: URL to download the file contents as smime with signature
**smime_uri**: URL to download the file contents encoded as smime
